args.name: id
args.description: The id to assign the cooldown to, can be anything

args.name: duration
args.description: The duration of the cooldown

args.name: code
args.description: The code to execute if the cooldown is active

args.name: id
args.description: The id to delete its cooldown

name: $deleteVar
description: Deletes a value from a variable

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the variable

args.name: id
args.description: The identifier of the value (a user, guild, channel, message, etc)

name: $getCooldownTime
description: Retrieves current cooldown time in ms for given id

args.name: id
args.description: The id to get its cooldown

name: $getDB
description: Returns all the identifiers stored in the DB

name: $getLeaderboardValue
description: Returns the position of a value in the leaderboard of a variable

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the variable

args.name: id
args.description: The identifier of the value (of a user, guild, channel, message, etc)

args.name: sort type
args.description: The sort type for the leaderboard, either asc/0 (ascending) or desc/1 (descending)

name: $getVar
description: Returns an identifier's value in a variable

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the variable

args.name: id
args.description: The identifier of the value (a user, guild, channel, message, etc)

args.name: default
args.description: The default value if the identifier doesn't exist in the variable

name: $leaderboard
description: Creates a leaderboard of identifiers in a variable

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the variable

args.name: envValue
args.description: The variable name to use for $env, retrieve the id with $env[<name>;id] and the value with $env[<name>;value]

args.name: envPosition
args.description: The variable name to use for $env, retrieve the position with $env[<name>]

args.name: code
args.description: Code to execute for each row, remember to use $return

args.name: sort type
args.description: The sort type for the leaderboard, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending)

args.name: max
args.description: The maximum number of rows per page

args.name: page
args.description: The page number

args.name: separator
args.description: The separator to use for each row

name: $setVar
description: Sets an identifier's value in a variable

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the variable

args.name: id
args.description: The identifier for the value (a user, guild, channel, message, etc)

args.name: value
args.description: The value
